column4: -- I think you need to specify the output file in an option like -o <outfile>
erUSUL I was wanting it to append to a file, the -O works, but overwrites. looking through the man I cant find a command that appends
Are you getting a wget that is getting interrupted?  Do you just need to use the -c flag for continue?

no wasnt getting disconnected. I just needed it to append to a file, so that when I log onto a server, it would pull a file and add a load of alias settings to a file to save me typing out commands loads all the time. Thanks for trying to help though :)
